intro: Galium andrewsii, commonly known as Andrews' bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in whorls along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
